title: Dont print constants
body_html:
Print constants inline in IR output. This makes reading the graphs easier, and follows the same semantics as not emitting instructions for constants.

I special-cased Tensor constants, because printing them out takes up a lot of space, and repeating their value inline for every usage makes the IR unreadable.

Now that we are printing out the ivalue inline, we are no longer explicitly printing out the type of the constant. I changed ivalue printing so that string / doubles / ints will always be distinguishable: "1" / 1 / 1.0 . This also makes it so our printing follows python conventions, and will make help the IR parser.
body_text:
Print constants inline in IR output.  This makes reading the graphs easier, and follows the same semantics as not emitting instructions for constants.
I special-cased Tensor constants, because printing them out takes up a lot of space, and repeating their value inline for every usage makes the IR unreadable.
Now that we are printing out the ivalue inline, we are no longer explicitly printing out the type of the constant. I changed ivalue printing so that string / doubles / ints will always be distinguishable: "1" / 1 / 1.0 . This also makes it so our printing follows python conventions, and will make help the IR parser.
body:
Print constants inline in IR output.  This makes reading the graphs easier, and follows the same semantics as not emitting instructions for constants. 

I special-cased Tensor constants, because printing them out takes up a lot of space, and repeating their value inline for every usage makes the IR unreadable. 

Now that we are printing out the ivalue inline, we are no longer explicitly printing out the type of the constant. I changed ivalue printing so that string / doubles / ints will always be distinguishable: "1" / 1 / 1.0 . This also makes it so our printing follows python conventions, and will make help the IR parser.
